title: Docs Error: Incorrect Output of torch.gels() Example
body_html:
(edited according to @SsnL 's comment) Output of torch.gels() example is incorrect.

I try to reprise the example in http://pytorch.org/docs/0.3.1/torch.html#torch.gels, which uses a 5x2 Tensor and a 5x3 Tensor to generate a 3x2 Tensor. However, my running generates a 5x2 Tensor. The output of example is incorrect.

  • OS: Windows 10 x64

  • PyTorch version: 0.3.0b0+591e73e

  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch

  • Python version: 3.6.0

  • CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A

  • GPU models and configuration: N/A

  • GCC version (if compiling from source): N/A

  • A script to reproduce the bug. Please try to provide as minimal of a test case as possible.

import torch
A = torch.Tensor([[1, 1, 1],
                  [2, 3, 4],
                  [3, 5, 2],
                  [4, 2, 5],
                  [5, 4, 3]])
B = torch.Tensor([[-10, -3],
                  [ 12, 14],
                  [ 14, 12],
                  [ 16, 16],
                  [ 18, 16]])
X, _ = torch.gels(B, A)
X
  • Error messages and/or stack traces of the bug

(edited according to @SsnL  's comment) Output of torch.gels() example is incorrect.
I try to reprise the example in http://pytorch.org/docs/0.3.1/torch.html#torch.gels, which uses a 5x2 Tensor and a 5x3 Tensor to generate a 3x2 Tensor. However, my running generates a 5x2 Tensor. The output of example is incorrect.


OS: Windows 10 x64


PyTorch version: 0.3.0b0+591e73e


How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch


Python version: 3.6.0

GPU models and configuration: N/A


GCC version (if compiling from source): N/A


A script to reproduce the bug. Please try to provide as minimal of a test case as possible.


import torch
A = torch.Tensor([[1, 1, 1],
                  [2, 3, 4],
                  [3, 5, 2],
                  [4, 2, 5],
                  [5, 4, 3]])

                  [ 12, 14],
                  [ 14, 12],
                  [ 16, 16],
                  [ 18, 16]])
X, _ = torch.gels(B, A)
X

body:
(edited according to @SsnL  's comment) **Output of torch.gels() example is incorrect.**

I try to reprise the example in http://pytorch.org/docs/0.3.1/torch.html#torch.gels, which uses a 5x2 Tensor and a 5x3 Tensor to generate a 3x2 Tensor. However, my running generates a 5x2 Tensor. The output of example is incorrect.

- OS: Windows 10 x64
- PyTorch version: 0.3.0b0+591e73e
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda install -c peterjc123 pytorch
- Python version: 3.6.0
- CUDA/cuDNN version: N/A
- GPU models and configuration: N/A
- GCC version (if compiling from source): N/A

- A script to reproduce the bug. Please try to provide as minimal of a test case as possible.
```
import torch
A = torch.Tensor([[1, 1, 1],
                  [2, 3, 4],
                  [3, 5, 2],
                  [4, 2, 5],
                  [5, 4, 3]])
B = torch.Tensor([[-10, -3],
                  [ 12, 14],
                  [ 14, 12],
                  [ 16, 16],
                  [ 18, 16]])
X, _ = torch.gels(B, A)
X
```

- Error messages and/or stack traces of the bug
